movies.title: Locker 69
movies.plot: A shady business man has perpetrated a fraud that has resulted in the death of a large number of people. His business partner has evidence of the fraud and threatens the fraudster with exposure in the event of any further dishonest dealing. But when the fraudster suddenly receives death threats he decides to fake his own murder.
movies.simplePlot: A shady business man has perpetrated a fraud that has resulted in the death of a large number of people. His business partner has evidence of the fraud and threatens the fraudster with ...

biography.bio: Walter Brown was born on February 9, 1927 in Auckland, New Zealand as Ian Walter Brown. He was an actor, known for Adventures of the Seaspray (1965), Dracula: Prince of Darkness (1966) and True Crime (1999). He died on October 31, 2013 in Deloraine, Tasmania, Australia.
biography.name: Walter Brown

biography.bio: Alfred Burke was born on February 28, 1918 in Peckham, London, England. He was an actor and writer, known for Public Eye (1965), Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2002) and Enemy at the Door (1978). He was married to Barbara Bonelle. He died on February 16, 2011 in Barnes, London.
biography.name: Alfred Burke

biography.bio: Larry Burns was born on July 1, 1911 in Belfast, Northern Ireland. He was an actor, known for The Gay Cavalier (1957), Scott of the Antarctic (1948) and Meet Mr. Callaghan (1954). He died in 1983 in London, England.
biography.name: Larry Burns

biography.bio: Eddie Byrne was born on January 31, 1911 in Birmingham, England. He was an actor, known for Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977), The Mummy (1959) and Mutiny on the Bounty (1962). He died on August 21, 1981 in Dublin, Ireland.
biography.name: Eddie Byrne

biography.bio: John Carson was a hugely prolific actor who appeared constantly on UK screens throughout the mid-50s until the mid-80s. He has appeared alongside many of the UK's stars and became hugely popular as a villain or hero. The secret of John's success was his versatility and his wonderful silky voice. He appeared in 3 Hammer films which led to an ever-increased popularity amongst film fans. John moved to South Africa from England in the 80s and, sadly, his appearances became far more sporadic although he always kept working, even producing and filming his own short documentary, "African Spirit". He the returned to England in 2007 and has been involved in a few films, such as The Deal (2008). He attended a John Carson Celebration Day in London (July 2009). This was the first time he had talked publicly about his long career in television, film and stage. The day was a huge success and, aside from a showing of two of his films, John gave an interview on stage and then signed autographs. The day was a huge success and this was proved so by a large attendance and the queues for his autograph and photos. John returned to South Africa in 2014 where he spent time with his family and got to relax a little. He sadly passed away on November 5th, 2016, he was a fine actor and leaves behind a legacy of his versatility on screen.
biography.name: John Carson

biography.bio: Paul Daneman was born on October 29, 1925 in London, England. He was an actor and writer, known for Zulu (1964), Spy Trap (1972) and Oh! What a Lovely War (1969). He was married to Meredith Kinmont and Susan Courtney. He died on April 28, 2001 in London.
biography.name: Paul Daneman

biography.bio: John Glyn-Jones was born on August 28, 1909 in London, England. He was an actor and producer, known for The Adventures of Hal 5 (1958), Waltz of the Toreadors (1962) and I'm All Right Jack (1959). He died on January 21, 1997 in Casablanca, Morocco.
biography.name: John Glyn-Jones

biography.bio: Penelope Horner was born on June 20, 1939 in London, England. She is an actress, known for The Angry Silence (1960), Half a Sixpence (1967) and Dracula (1974).
biography.name: Penelope Horner

biography.bio: Philip Latham was born on January 17, 1929 in Essex, England as Charles Philip Latham. He is an actor, known for The Cedar Tree (1976), The Pallisers (1974) and Force 10 from Navarone (1978). He has been married to Eve Latham since September 12, 1960. They have two children.
biography.name: Philip Latham

biography.bio: Norma Parnell was born on March 28, 1937 in Liverpool, England as Norma Pownall. She is an actress, known for The Silent Weapon (1961), Operation Cupid (1960) and Love Story (1959).
biography.name: Norma Parnell

biography.bio: Edwin Richfield was born on September 11, 1921 in London, England. He was an actor and writer, known for Interpol Calling (1959), The Odd Man (1960) and The Buccaneers (1956). He was married to Jan Holden. He died on August 2, 1990 in Shrewsbury, England.
biography.name: Edwin Richfield

biography.bio: Leonard Sachs was born on September 26, 1909 in Roodeport, Transvaal, South Africa as Leonard Meyer Sachs. He was an actor and director, known for The Good Old Days (1953), Thunderball (1965) and Scream of Fear (1961). He was married to Eleanor Summerfield. He died on June 15, 1990 in Westminster, London, England.
biography.name: Leonard Sachs

biography.bio: Clarissa Stolz is an actress, known for The Count of Luxemburg (1957), Locker 69 (1962) and The Edgar Wallace Mystery Theatre (1960).
biography.name: Clarissa Stolz

biography.bio: A London-born stage and film veteran, actor Edward Underdown was educated at Eton College and began in theatre roles in 1932 with "Words and Music". A former jockey and steeplechase rider, he quickly forged ahead in films making his debut in The Warren Case (1934) and appearing in secondary roles. A tall, officious and good looking gent, he came into his own in post-war film leads and supports with prominent roles in The October Man (1947), Her Panelled Door (1950), The Dark Man (1951), Murder Will Out (1952), The Shadow Man (1953), and John Huston's cult overseas hit Beat the Devil (1953) starring Humphrey Bogart and Jennifer Jones in which he played Jones' prim dullard of a husband. Most of his work was in dismissible "B" level fare as dour, damp, stuffy types. He started moving down the credits list in 1960s horrors and action drama until he was reduced to bit parts. Over the course of his career, he played everything from British lords to archaeologists, but never branched out into a successful international career. Things might have turned out differently had a little more luck come his way. It seems writer Ian Fleming's first choice for the role of James "007" Bond was the handsome but still relatively undistinguished Underdown, but the actor was never even considered by producer Albert R. Broccoli. Of course, Sean Connery soared to stardom in the part and, ironically, Underdown wound up with a very small part in one of the more popular of the film series Thunderball (1965). Underdown died in his native England on December 15, 1989 at age 81.
biography.name: Edward Underdown
